content.description: Climbs the steep slab to the right of Wiessner's Ankle. Very fun route with lots of cool iron bands as holds.
Climbs the nice slab to the left of Wiessner's Ankle.
Start crouching on the large platform. Make big compression moves with toe hooks and heel hooks to a technical top out.
content.location: This route starts underneath the large, near horizontal block, and it climbs the underside trending right.

content.description: Climbs the featured arete to a pretty high topout. Rock quality is great.
content.location: Can be seen from the green trail. In between the Tummy Time boulder and Ancient Alien.

content.description: Start low with a good left hand crimp in the lowest horizontal seam and a right hand on the arete. Work up into the roof and dyno to the jug on the face. Top out directly overhead. The crux is one of the coolest moves I've ever done.
content.location: Follow the broken cliffband northeast from Make America Gay Again. Look for a small cave hidden in the cliffband.

content.description: Start sitting in the large hole. Pull into a solid knee bar, climb up and left. Very fun movement. Tricky beta makes it much easier.
content.location: On the backside of the same boulder as Tummy Time and Hard Headed. You can't see it coming from the tail.

content.description: Starts on the large platform and climbs up and over a small ledge. Some of the large holds sound hollow, but seem to be pretty solid.
content.protection: pads. Be careful on some of the large hollow jugs.
content.location: Starts the same as Tummy Time, but climbs left on jugs.

content.description: Starts on a good right hand side pull and good sloper for the left. Stand on large block and jump to a jug overhead (or reach if you are tall). Tops out on progressively easier terrain.
content.location: Far right side of the Wiessner boulder.

content.description: Starts sitting on a good triangular hold. Climbs up for a few moves then tops out over the edge of the arete. Beautiful feature and fun climb with interesting holds.
content.location: Directly off of the green trail facing NE.

content.description: Starts matched on a large platform with feet in the small corner. Climbs into the crack on the face of the boulder and tops out.
content.location: Face NE. Sits almost in the middle of the talus, but can be seen from the green trial. About 100 meters North of Birch.

content.description: A nice cluster of extremely high-quality bouldering, mostly in the talus between the Left Hip and the Left Leg. The rock here is solid and has great texture and friction.
